title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 將欲取天下而為之，吾見其不得已。
passages.en: (Taking no action) If any one should wish to get the kingdom for himself, and to effect this by what he does, I see that he will not succeed.

passages.zh: 天下神器，不可為也，為者敗之，執者失之。
passages.en: The kingdom is a spirit-like thing, and cannot be got by active doing. He who would so win it destroys it; he who would hold it in his grasp loses it.

passages.zh: 故物或行或隨；或歔或吹；或強或羸；或挫或隳。
passages.en: The course and nature of things is such that what was in front is now behind; what warmed anon we freezing find. Strength is of weakness oft the spoil; the store in ruins mocks our toil.

passages.zh: 是以聖人去甚，去奢，去泰。
passages.en: Hence the sage puts away excessive effort, extravagance, and easy indulgence.
